context: Recent developments in LEDs permit them to be used in <a0_0><b5_0>environmental<b5_0/><a0_0/> and task lighting. LEDs have many advantages over incandescent light sources including lower energy consumption, <a1_0><b6_0>longer lifetime<b6_0/><a1_0/>, improved physical robustness, smaller size, and faster switching. <a2_0><b7_0>Light-emitting diodes<b7_0/><a2_0/> are now used in applications as diverse as aviation lighting, automotive headlamps, advertising, general lighting, <a4_0>traffic signals<a4_0/>, camera flashes and lighted wallpaper. As of 2015[update], LEDs powerful enough for room lighting remain somewhat <a3_0><b8_0>more expensive<b8_0/><a3_0/>, and require <b9_0>more precise<b9_0/> current and heat management, than compact fluorescent lamp sources of comparable output.
